In a cursory search of the Tibetan holdings at the Nepal National Archives during the summer of 1999, I located more than fifty separate listings for manuscripts and blockprints of the Diamond Cutter Sutra, and almost twenty for the Benefits. These exemplars originated from monasteries and temples across the Nepal Himalayas. A thorough study of these would certainly tell us much about the Buddhist cult of the book in the Himalayas
